unnormalised: A typical patient record includes vitals like BP 120/80, temperature 98.6Â°F, and a glucose level of 110 mg/dL; understanding these numbers is crucial for healthcare professionals to make accurate diagnoses and treatment plans. Also keep an eye on things like HbA1c, targeting <7% for diabetics per recent guidelines.
normalised: A typical patient record includes vitals like B-P one hundred and twenty divided by eighty, temperature ninety eight point six degree Fahrenheit, and a glucose level of one hundred and ten milligram per deciliter; understanding these numbers is crucial for healthcare professionals to make accurate diagnoses and treatment plans. Also keep an eye on things like H-b-A-one-c, targeting less than seven percent for diabetics per recent guidelines.
